column1: 0$Condition: Bipolar Disorder in Remission$10/2/2019 4:07:54 AM$Reviewer: Carley
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I took Abilify 30mg orally from 2006 to 2015 then was placed on Abilify Maintaina 400 in 2015 to May of 2019. This is a Miracle Drug for me. I had 0 side effect and 0 side affects affecting my long term physical health! It also managed my schizo effective bi polar symptoms as I had none. I was placed on Aristada indecio
column3: the new replacement for Abilify Maintaina in May 2019 I've been to the ER 5xs since with physical health issues related to this injection. Nausea
column6: my tongue swelled after the initial dose. And was treated with a Benzodiazapine that interacts with this new so called aristada. I 250% approve of Abilify after research for my own wellbeing. Muscle spasms an Charlie horse like cramps in my ribs and back
column7: muscle dignity. Now my eyelids have begun to twitch from aristada. I 0% approve of Aristada at least for me.  Concerned Consumer.

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $1$1$1$I gained 100 lbs. while on Abilify. I was on the pills first for years
column3: then they switched me to these injections. I went from weighing 145 to 245 lbs. I am miserable
column4: but am FORCED to take this. It is as if it is drying me out in my digestive system: I have been constipated ever since I've been on it
column5: and have to keep a bottle of Milk of Magnesia on hand to relieve that. And I cannot urinate like I used to. The quantity of liquid coming out of me is much less than the amount I drink. The only good thing I can say is that it makes me feel less sleepy than other anti-psychotic medications. I agree with the other reviewer's post: This medication is poison.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I find that this med helps with the voices.  now I can control what voices I hear.
25-34 Female  (Patient) $1$1$1$This treatment has shown me no valuable affects for treatment of manic bi polar disorder. I feel and see no difference as if I were taking a placebo.

column1: 4$Condition: Other$5/11/2013 9:08:29 AM$Reviewer:  (Patient) $1$1$1$"Abilify gave me hallucinations and delusions on the second day when I NEVER had them before. When I complained to my doctor and insisted I would not take it
column2: he threw a fit! Then I learned Medicare pays $683 to the drug-maker for this poison. Apparently
column3: my doctor needed me on this drug to pay for the mags on his Porsche. Do NOT take this poison!"
